forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy. Low around 51, with temperatures rising to around 53 overnight. Southeast wind around 10 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 4pm. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South wind 7 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 30 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The overnight skies in Downtown San Francisco have settled into a mostly cloudy embrace, a soft veil interrupted only by the hum of the city’s nocturnal activities. As dawn quietly approaches with temperatures hovering around fifty-one degrees, the air carries a gentle hint of rising humidity, with a light southeast wind stirring to around ten miles per hour. The promise of a mild, rainy Saturday looms, with clouds thickening as the day wears on. Rain is expected to grace the city before mid-afternoon, best paired with a sensible umbrella to shield from the anticipated showers. Highs will flirt with sixty degrees, gently dipping as the day progresses, accompanied by breezier gusts which may reach thirty miles per hour.

The scenery is likely draped in a cloak of fog, particularly around the iconic Golden Gate, invoking a chill that might make one linger longer indoors. Yet, therein lies an invitation: the cozy warmth of a nearby café, the aroma of freshly brewed coffee mingling with pastries, or perhaps a leisurely walk along the less traveled paths of the city, where the drizzling rain creates a rhythm to the day. As the weather ushers in a grayness that softens the city’s sharp edges, consider a sweater layered beneath a raincoat to stay comfortable amid this changeable charm. Engaging with the local art scene or curling up with a novel lends a peaceful backdrop to a day where time feels gently suspended.
